Description: Sherd of body of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; cream slip; outside reserved with two broad bands of glaze; inside: black-figure animal frieze; part of one animal and tail of a feline, with incised rosette fill; incised inscription on outside.
Curator's comments: From the same bowl as1888,0601.557b-c, with 1965,0930.711, and the joined sherds 1924,1201.993 and 1924,1201.994. The inscription is in a different position with respect to the external bands on the two sets of sherds, but this need not exclude their belonging together. It must be very likely that this is the plate described in fuller detail by Hutton, Classical Review 1893, 83 as a dedication by a Rhodian. Gardner, however, records the beginning of the name of Charmes, not in Hutton, who has nu not mu, which is not an easy mistake, unless it is a typo. Fragment b does has fresh breaks and may indicate a previously fuller state. Hutton's interpretation of the letter, now lost, as a rho, and therefore the beginning of the ethnic Rodios, must be doubted; we would expect the definite article, and ο Χιος or ο Τηιος would fit well.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 65, no. 776, pl. XXI, no. 776)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 684, no. 427)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.266)
